revised_title: The Pineal Eye in Sphenodon and Other Lizards
tldr: The author examines the structure and presence of the median eye in Sphenodon and other lizards, also known as the pineal eye. They find that this eye is an invertebrate-like structure widely distributed among Lacertilians. The pineal eye is connected to the brain via a medianly placed nerve, and its presence and structure provide insights into the evolution of the eye and its various functions.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Comparative Anatomy
